grins
Interface SMILDocument

public interface SMILDocument

The interface for managing SMIL documents. SMILDocument are produced by GRiNSToolkit using the factory method createDocument(String filenameOrURLString) After using a SMILDocument you should always call close() to dispose used resources.

Method Summary
 void close()
          After using a SMILDocument you should always call this method to dispose resources allocated for this document.
 SMILController getController()
          To playback a SMIL document you need an object implementing the interface of a SMILController.
 double getDuration()
          Get the duration of this document in seconds.
 SMILRenderer getRenderer()
          Returns an object implementing the interface of a SMILRenderer.
 int getViewportCount()
          Get the number of top level windows of this SMIL document.
 java.awt.Dimension getViewportSize(int index)
          Get the top level window size associated with the zero based index
 java.lang.String getViewportTitle(int index)
          Get the top level window title associated with the zero based index
 boolean isViewportOpen(int index)
          Returns true if the the top level window associated with the zero based index is open.
 

Method Detail

getController

public SMILController getController()
To playback a SMIL document you need an object implementing the interface of a SMILController. Use this method to acquire such an object

getRenderer

public SMILRenderer getRenderer()
Returns an object implementing the interface of a SMILRenderer. A SMILRenderer is used to associate a SMILCanavas with a document viewport.

getViewportCount

public int getViewportCount()
Get the number of top level windows of this SMIL document. Top level windows are asigned an index.

getViewportSize

public java.awt.Dimension getViewportSize(int index)
Get the top level window size associated with the zero based index

getViewportTitle

public java.lang.String getViewportTitle(int index)
Get the top level window title associated with the zero based index

isViewportOpen

public boolean isViewportOpen(int index)
Returns true if the the top level window associated with the zero based index is open.

getDuration

public double getDuration()
Get the duration of this document in seconds. A zero duration means indefinite A negative duration means unresolved

close

public void close()
After using a SMILDocument you should always call this method to dispose resources allocated for this document.
